caption: Kinda dirty and a lot of tags are on the bridge but the view is really nice to see, maybe some trash can could help resolve the garbage issue. I had no problem crossing it.
A nice bridge crossing the river Seine and overlooking a beautiful neighborhood.
A very unique and beautiful bridge!

Despite this bridge not being as famous as some of the others, this bridge still gives some beautiful panoramic views of the city of Paris along the Seine and still offers a really nice walk. It‚Äôs open all the time and is really beautiful at any time of the day, especially during sunrise or sunset when the sun reflects against the Paris skyline or at night when the skyline is all lit up. Since it‚Äôs close to many of the attractions of the city, it‚Äôs a great location for those wanting to spend time in the city. And since it‚Äôs not as popular as the other bridges, it is not that packed with tourists, making it more enjoyable of a stroll to some. The architectural work of the bridge is also absolutely stunning, and is a great opportunity for photos.

The Pont Charles-de-Gaulle bridge straddling the river Seine in the eastern part of Paris neer the place in Gare De Lyon area where we were staying. Fun to watch the boats go by, and lot of places to take great photos.
Only the bridge that make this place very nice

It is a nice bridge and tries to be at the same time, modern and classic, at least in the solid volume that makes it up. There are no stones anymore, but metal fulfills that mission.

Great for going to maraudes, especially by bus when it works (and at the moment it's only in one direction without any clear display or replacement bus üë®‚Äçü¶Ω). Ps: if cycle path on the bridge and elsewhere PMR have priority. In approximately good condition with accessibility OK except on the slope. Please rent electric wheelchairs or scooters with attachments everywhere
We stayed at Citizen Hotel. There were restrictions before the Olympic opening ceremony, but I want to come again next year.

White steel bridge resembling an airplane wing resting on discreet piers whose modernity contrasts with the Austerlitz bridge upstream. From the Quai d'Austerlitz, we have a beautiful perspective on the other bank where the belfry of the Gare de Lyon stands.

Convenient for crossing and connecting the Lyon and Austerlitz stations. However, the bridge requires renovation and the cleanliness leaves something to be desired because the closed trash cans have been sealed (probably for the vigipirate plan). Substitute bins have certainly been put in place, but there are too few of them and their position gives the impression of a sloppy arrangement. The surroundings of the bridge lack careful and coherent landscaping, shade, and greenery. The access to the quays of the Seine are poorly indicated and lack maintenance (not to mention the smell of urine at the stairs leading to the quays of the Seine). In short, this bridge is a practical way to get around but nothing makes you want to linger there.
Elegant low-height bridge, equipped with a wide cycle path for bikes and scooters and allows you to admire a beautiful sunset ‚òÄÔ∏è
Architecturally interesting, traffic at rush hour, as in any city, chaos.

Less famous than some other bridges in Paris, this one has charm and offers a beautiful view of the Seine and part of the city. It is also very useful for traveling between the two stations.
Very practical bridge which connects the 2 stations. Wide bridge where pedestrians have room to move around and no interactions with bicycles and scooters

This bridge connects the Gare d'Austerlitz and Gare de Lyon districts. To the east, view of the Bercy bridge, to the west view of Notre-Dame, in the distance. Road, cycle and pedestrian bridge, it is very cold in winter and very hot in summer!
Magnificent view of the no less successful Le Monde newspaper building
